item.title: Design and Construction of an Affordable Adjustable Repetition Rate Optical Frequency Comb
item.description: arXiv:2503.08635v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We designed and built an adjustable repetition rate optical frequency comb using off-the-shelf components with several improvements to an established erbium fiber design. This design, built fully by an undergraduate, was assembled at a fraction of the cost of a commercial comb. This comb has a repetition rate of roughly 100 MHz with a tuning range of 3 MHz. A stabilization control loop for $f_{rep}$ achieved long term drifts of < 1 Hz over several days. This comb will eventually be implemented for use in dual-comb spectroscopy.
item.dc:creator: Christopher E. Latchford, Daniel L. Maser
